title: How to Wear Makeup with Grey Hair

steps.title: Define your eyebrows to avoid looking washed out.
steps.content: Define your eyebrows to avoid looking washed out. Your eyebrows help to frame your face, so it’s important to distinguish them from the hair on your head. [1] X Research source Apply brow liner as part of your daily routine or dye your eyebrows for a low maintenance option. You don’t have to make your brows look fake—you just want to keep them looking as natural as possible while still standing out. [2] X Research source For slate-colored hair, consider doing your brows in ash brown, hickory, umber, or dark gray. For light gray hair, try slate or gray brows. For white hair, gray or taupe brows would look good. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Highlight your cheeks using blush.
steps.content: Highlight your cheeks using blush. Blush is a great way to combat looking washed out by adding some color to your face. Apply the blush to the apples of your cheeks to brighten them up. [4] X Research source When selecting a blush, choose a light color that makes your complexion more vibrant and youthful. [5] X Expert Source Charina Redugerio Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 26 May 2020. If you have fair skin, stick with warm and light colors like rose, peach, or light pink. Olive skin tones look great in brighter colors like peony. For dark complexions, choose richer colors like dusty rose or coral. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Choose light-colored eyeshadows to maintain a youthful appearance.
steps.content: Choose light-colored eyeshadows to maintain a youthful appearance. Stick to light, neutral colors like white, beige, light browns, or grey when applying eyeshadow . These colors will work to bring your eyes forward. [7] X Research source When you have grey hair, using silver and grey eyeshadow can help tie your whole look together. Try pairing that with brown or black for a flattering smokey eyeshadow look. [8] X Expert Source Charina Redugerio Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 26 May 2020. Always choose powdered matte colors. Avoid cream or liquid eyeshadows, and those with glimmer or glitter because they can emphasize fine lines and wrinkles, making you appear older. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Apply darker eyeshadows if you want to stand out.
steps.content: Apply darker eyeshadows if you want to stand out. If you like to be a little bolder, try an eyeshadow palette that features a variety of colors. Charcoal grey, purples, and even navy blue are great options for nighttime makeup and bolder looks. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Line your eyes to make your features pop.
steps.content: Line your eyes to make your features pop. Liquid and gel liners may be too dramatic, but of course, you can experiment to find out what looks best on you. A nice pencil liner in brown, slate, or navy will definitely work to accent your eyes without being too harsh. [11] X Research source If you have a lighter skin tone, you may want to avoid wearing black eyeliner because it can contrast too heavily with your grey hair. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Try a bold lip color.
steps.content: Try a bold lip color. This may feel uncomfortable for some people, especially if you are used to wearing neutral shades. But stay away from neutral shades on your lips when you have grey hair because they have the tendency to leave you looking grey all over. [13] X Research source If you just can’t do bold, at least try a color that is a couple of shades deeper than your natural lip color. [14] X Research source Apply a clear lip liner to keep your lipstick from bleeding. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Select high-quality makeup.
steps.content: Select high-quality makeup. If it’s in your budget, purchase your makeup at the cosmetic counter in a department store. There, you also have the benefit of a trained professional to help you make good choices based on your skin tone and your shade of grey. [16] X Research source If it’s not in your budget, or you just aren’t that into makeup, it’s definitely okay to purchase your makeup at a drugstore. They carry a wide range of products at affordable prices, and the quality has improved greatly over the years. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Protect your skin from the sun to avoid extra wrinkles.
steps.content: Protect your skin from the sun to avoid extra wrinkles. Deep wrinkles can make it harder to apply your makeup evenly, and the makeup can actually draw more attention to your wrinkles. Stay in the shade when you can, and wear a water-resistant sunscreen with an SPF of at least 30. [18] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Cover up in style with sunglasses and wide-brimmed sun hats.

steps.title: Apply a moisturizer
steps.content: Apply a moisturizer in the morning and at night. Purchase a moisturizing cream that is specially formulated for use in the morning. These lightweight moisturizers plump your skin which reduces the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles. A nighttime moisturizer is richer and contains a higher level of anti-aging ingredients. It works by trapping water under your skin which gives you a more youthful appearance in general. [19] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Wash your face at least once a day with warm water and a mild cleanser.
steps.content: Wash your face at least once a day with warm water and a mild cleanser. Everyone should wash their face at night before they go to bed to remove dirt, oil, and makeup. If it helps, use a makeup remover wipe to take off your makeup before applying a facial cleanser. [20] X Research source Wash gently using your hands or a clean washcloth. Avoid soap and rough scrubbing. If you have oily skin, wash your face in the morning as well before applying fresh makeup.
